descr.name: Binding affinity to sigma-1 receptor in human MCF7 cells
description: Title: Involvement of apoptosis and autophagy in the death of RPMI 8226 multiple myeloma cells by two enantiomeric sigma receptor ligands.

Abstract: Over-expression of  inverted question mark receptors by many tumor cell lines makes ligands for these receptors attractive as potential chemotherapeutic drugs. Enantiomeric piperazines (S)-4 and (R)-4 were prepared as potential  inverted question mark-receptor ligands in a chiral pool synthesis starting from (S)- and (R)-aspartate. Both compounds showed high affinities for the  inverted question mark inverted question mark and  inverted question mark inverted question mark receptors. In the human multiple myeloma cell line RPMI 8226, a line expressing high levels of  inverted question mark receptors, both compounds inhibited cell proliferation with IC inverted question mark inverted question mark values in the low  inverted question markM range. No chiral differentiation between either the  inverted question mark receptor binding affinity or the cytotoxicity of the two enantiomers was observed. Both compounds induced apoptosis, which was evidenced by nuclear condensation, binding of annexin-V to phosphatidylserine in the outer leaf of the cell membrane, cleavage products of poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase-1 (PARP-1) and caspase-8 as well as the expression of bcl inverted question mark family members bax, bad and bid. However, apoptosis appeared to be caspase independent. Increased levels of the phosphorylated form of the microtubule associated protein light chain 3-II (LC3-II), an autophagosome marker, gave evidence that both compounds induced autophagy. However, further data (e.g., treatment with wortmannin) indicate that autophagy is incomplete and not cytoprotective. Lipid peroxidation (LPO) was observed in RPMI 8226 cells treated with the two compounds, and the lipid antioxidant  inverted question mark-tocopherol attenuated LPO. Interestingly,  inverted question mark-tocopherol reduced significantly both apoptosis and autophagy induced by the compounds. These results provide evidence that, by initiating LPO and changes in mitochondrial membrane potential, both compounds induce apoptosis and autophagy in RPMI 8226 cells.
comment: Compounds with activity <= 50uM or explicitly reported as active by ChEMBL are flagged as active in this PubChem assay presentation.
ChEMBL Target Name: Sigma opioid receptor
ChEMBL Target Type: SINGLE PROTEIN - Target is a single protein chain
Relationship Type: D - Direct protein target assigned
Confidence: Direct single protein target assigned

results.name: PubChem Standard Value
description: PubChem standardized value transformed from 'Standard Value'. The unit is always micromolar

results.name: Standard Type
description: Standardized activity type (e.g. IC50 rather than Ic-50/Ic50/ic50/ic-50)

results.name: Standard Value
description: Standardized activity value transformed to common units: e.g. mM concentrations converted to nM

results.name: Standard Units
description: Selected units for 'Standard Type': e.g. concentrations are in nM
